title: Meddler what happened to the new Lissandra passive you were working on?
body: Since she didnt get her mana regen changed with the rest of the mages are you any closer to changing her passive?

replies.body:
Tried a number of variants on shield passives, didn't find a version that generated engaging gameplay for her however (just added tankiness basically). Would still like to find a more satisfying passive for her, want something that creates some interesting decisions though, particularly if its adding significant power.

Not sure why her base mana wasn't changed with the standardization of other mages, will follow up on that, check if deliberate decision or overlooked.

By the way, since her passive will be irrelevant after the final change, can we also have the much needed (and logical) change of her Q actually being an AoE slow instead of just a single target?

She currently doesn't have it because she would lower the cd of the passive by 6 with each attempt to clear a wave, so from a balancing point it does make some sense, but it the passive is no longer relevant, it would be a neat and much needed change.

------------------------------------------
On the debate about the actual passive though.

Also, would adding more utility for the team be a passive up for debate? Like a way to reduce armor(not a typo, just a way of supporting the team's AD members) to your targets or somehow shift your movement speed slows to attack speed slows (with mitigated results, like 1/4 or 1/3 obviously), etc.

Or, since her damage output has been shifted towards her Q so heavily, maybe a stacking mechanic. This could help her deal with tanks for example by having a small amount of % dmg in there. Nothing too strong though, just something like "the first target hit with Ice Shard will have a X stack applied to them. Ring of Frost will apply a X stack if it roots only a single target. Max stacks of 5. Upon casting Frozen Tomb on the target, the stacks are consumed and deal an extra 2% of max hp as magic damage per stack."

This gives an incentive to play around a little before casting Frozen Tomb, stacking up with Ice shard. Additionally, since it's the first target hit only, the lane poke wouldn't contribute to this. In general, it gives a reason for her to do an extended close combat skirmish in order to have the maximum possible damage output. In general, we are talking about ~6-8 seconds of having to be in medium range before going for the tomb.



Whether you find these passives possible or not, please take into serious consideration the Q buff if her passive goes, because it something that she could use, since all her utility is soft-cc(except for frozen tomb), she should at least have a decent amount of it.

What if a shield was attached to her W instead of her passive. eg: she gains a shield whose strength scales with with number of enemy champions rooted. As an all-in short range champion she would definitely appreciate the extra tankiness even if it doesn't change her play pattern too much (you still want to root as many enemies as possible anyway).

Just wondering if her passive is changed from the free spell, if her Mana costs will be adjusted accordingly. 85 mana on Q early is kind of rough without it...

Edit: just reading some other ideas, wanted to toss in my hat. What if Lissandra has a passive that slowly stacks, up to a cap, say 5. Each stack grants her bonus resistances, however, each spell she casts consumes one stack and grants bonus damage/utility (maybe applies a debuff like others are saying). This hopefully creates the interesting play between saving stacks to be tanky or using them to deal more damage (sort of like how Ori can keep the ball on herself for resistances or send it out to apply pressure), and sort of fits with her old playstyle of waiting longer between spell casts for the free spell. Thematically it's like she's gathering ice that she uses as armor, but also consumes to use as a weapon.

What about this:

Lissandra gain a stack on her passive every time she damage an enemy champion with her basic attacks or abilities. While reaching 6 stacks she gain a shield that block the next incoming projectile and returns splash magic damage that also briefly slows the enemy.

I have a suggestion for a passive. :D

I think something like Katarina's old killer instincts, or Karma's mantra but on a lesser scale would suit Lissandra, where every time her passive comes off of cooldown, her next basic ability is modified. It would encourage interesting decision making on both sides of a lane, where both Liss and her opponent would want to keep tabs on whether her passive is up or not.

Given her identity as a CC mage, I think it would be most fitting if the changes were relayed solely to her CC rather than damage.

For instance:

**Passive : Iceborn**

Lissandra's next ability gains an additional effect.

Ice Shard: Gains X% slow.
Ring of Frost: Gains .X seconds snare.
Glacial Path: Slows enemies by X% around Lissandra when cast. (*More helpful for escapes.*)
Frozen Tomb: Slows enemies by an additional X%.


I didn't bother adding numbers, since I'm not a game balancer. xD But anyway, I think a passive like this would be cool, but also add a LOT of balancing levers to Lissandra to add or remove power as needed, and I think each effect has it's own benefits; there wouldn't be only one ability the player would use it on. It would depend on the situation. Some are great for initiating and some are better for escaping.

The time-based thing might be difficult for players, but I think a charge system like Annie's could be used for more reliability.

Also, obviously, you could change the effects, like maybe it's more fitting for a charged q to slow all targets hit instead, or for a charged e to reduce the cooldown. There's a lot of options. xD

I had an idea for a Lissandra passive, where a % of damage dealt to Champions by her spells (heavily reduced against minions) is returned as a shield. She can have a maximum shield based on level and max HP and AP (one or the other as well). Thematically it would as if when her spell hits things it shatters, and she reabsorbs the crystals as a shield. It would accumulate and stay either permanently or for a long time, slowly disappearing as if it's melting (not sure how to work around True Ice). To balance it taking damage prevents shield generation for a time, and if she Ult herself she doesn't gain shield strength (because she had invincibility and she's technically untargetable), you could even make the shield generation have a small delay to give a small window.
So.. basically morde passive......
